title_sort: rudolf schmidt to walt whitman, 3 november 1882
title: Rudolf Schmidt to Walt Whitman, 3 November 1882
text: Copenhagen,3thrd Nov 1882.Dear W:W.Received today "the Literary world" I am extremely glad for such papers. Ibsen is indeed a great poet—the rival and deadly foe of Bjørnson. I read with great pleasure in "Specimen days." I shall translate "The death of AbrAbraham Lincoln. But at present I have no leisure, I aam writing tale after tale. In "Buster og masker" you will find yourself named in the essay on Elster, page 38 and in that on Paul de Saint-Victor page 195–96. Let someone translate these two pages (a comparison) to you. Can you not get "Buster og masker" mentioned in America?Rudolf SchmidtKeep this if you want it. Rudolf Schmidt to Walt Whitman, 3 November 1882
